product_name: L'angeLe Styliste Luxe Digital Salon Dryer
summary: SummaryExperience drying & styling in a luxe new way with L'ange's Le Styliste Luxe Digital Salon Dryer. This quiet dryer features a slim, modern frame that weighs under a pound to provide a comfortable, ergonomic feel to be used by the professional stylist, the hair enthusiast, and everyone in between!
details: DetailsBenefitsSignificantly reduces drying timeLightweight, ergonomic design for easy stylingHelps minimize static & frizzReduced ambient noise outputFeatures4 heat & 3 speed settings + cool shotQuiet brushless motorEfficient, high-performance powerLCD displayIncludesDiffuser2 Air ConcentratorsItem 2594880How To UsePrepare wet hair by gently detangling, and applying your favorite styling product(s) to begin rough drying hair. Plug in your dryer, press the ON/OFF button for 1-2 seconds to turn the dryer on. Select your airflow speed (this will be indicated by a series of lights on the digital display):One Light = Low SpeedTwo Lights = Medium SpeedThree Lights = High SpeedOnce you choose your preferred setting, press the middle button to select your heat setting (this will be indicated by the temperature on the digital display):No Temperature Indicated = Cool140¬∞ F = Warm190¬∞ F = Medium 250¬∞ F = HighGently rough dry hair (on lower heat) until approximately 70% dry. Next, separate hair into manageable sections and secure the rest out of the way. Using a higher heat setting, finish blow drying with your brush of choice. Work the brush through hair, aiming the airflow in a downward motion. For extra volume, concentrate airflow at the roots. Continue until your desired look is achieved. Press and hold the cool shot button to lock in your style and run the dryer over your hair. Turn off and unplug the dryer when finished. Once the dryer has completely cooled, store in a safe location.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Prepare wet hair by gently detangling, and applying your favorite styling product(s) to begin rough drying hair. Plug in your dryer, press the ON/OFF button for 1-2 seconds to turn the dryer on. Select your airflow speed (this will be indicated by a series of lights on the digital display):One Light = Low SpeedTwo Lights = Medium SpeedThree Lights = High SpeedOnce you choose your preferred setting, press the middle button to select your heat setting (this will be indicated by the temperature on the digital display):No Temperature Indicated = Cool140¬∞ F = Warm190¬∞ F = Medium 250¬∞ F = HighGently rough dry hair (on lower heat) until approximately 70% dry. Next, separate hair into manageable sections and secure the rest out of the way. Using a higher heat setting, finish blow drying with your brush of choice. Work the brush through hair, aiming the airflow in a downward motion. For extra volume, concentrate airflow at the roots. Continue until your desired look is achieved. Press and hold the cool shot button to lock in your style and run the dryer over your hair. Turn off and unplug the dryer when finished. Once the dryer has completely cooled, store in a safe location.

reviews.headline: Nice, light and quiet - love except power button
reviews.comments: The only dislike about this hair dryer is the off button - it has to be held down and then shuts off - not an automatic off...I'll go back and read the directions in case I missed anything about the power button.

reviews.headline: Heating element
reviews.comments: I love this dryer. But had it for one month and 5 days and started only blowing cold air and no heat. Exchanged for another and hoping it does not happen again. Save your receipt ladies!!

reviews.headline: Only 3 years
reviews.comments:
I loved this blow dryer. The lightness, and it does get hot and dry quickly I could do a blowout 30-45 minutes. 
After a year the cold shot button was stuck and couldn't feel the click of the button. The metal piece that holds the attachment completely came off.

reviews.headline: good hairdryer
reviews.comments:
I have been using this hairdryer at least 2 times a week for the last year and a half. it continues to work fine. I love how lightweight it is. the airspeed and heat are great. I just wish that there were more options because it leaves my hair a bit frizzy. my dyson never did that (but this is half the price).
if you're considering other options, know this. my dyson was a better dryer but it stopped working after 1 1/2 years. I had bo recourse and it wound up in the trash. it was also quite a bit heavier. what a heartbreak!

reviews.headline: Barely 1 yr old STOPPED WORKING
reviews.comments: Bought this blowdryer 15 mos ago. Comletely stopped working. Only used 1x/week. Total waste of money, I have had $30 blowdryers last me 10 years. Defective product, would NEVER buy again! Out of warranty after 1 year, no surprise here, why do ee spend our har earned money on products rhat dont last. Such a scam and ripoff!!

reviews.headline: Stopped heating
reviews.comments: Absolutely loved this hair dryer when I got it. After just over a year, it stopped heating up. Come to find out they only offer a one year warranty. I had a $30 conair that never failed me for 8 years and just wanted to splurge on something nicer. Waste of money

reviews.headline: Returned and very poor dryer
reviews.comments: Very disappointed in this dryer. Handle is a failed design‚Ä¶.as you hold the dryer the temp button does not stay fixed.  My hair frizzed with this dryer.

reviews.headline: Love this hairdryer
reviews.comments: This hairdryer dries hair quickly and fast and it's very lightweight. Ive used every professional brand out there and I love the Lange line. I use all of their tools.

reviews.headline: heat stopped working
reviews.comments: Like MANY other reviews for this product, I'm here to report that this completely stopped heating up. mind you, I do not use this every day. I blowdry my hair maybe once a week or less, and I clean out the filter as recommended. It stopped blowing hot air. This is an expensive dryer that you'd expect to last years. Just don't waste your money on this one.

reviews.headline: Do not buy
reviews.comments: I had this hair dryer for a little over 2 years, didn't really use it much until the last year or so (had a baby and didn't style my hair much during pregnancy or the first year of his life). Recently I have been using it twice a week. The magnet broke off (and into many pieces) which holds the attachments and the plastic around the cord where it attachs to the plug also broke which seems dangerous like the wires are now exposed. Definitely not worth over $200, or even worth $50.

reviews.headline: Do not buy
reviews.comments: I had this hair dryer for a little over 2 years, didn't really use it much until the last year or so (had a baby and didn't style my hair much during pregnancy or the first year of his life). Recently I have been using it twice a week. The magnet broke off (and into many pieces) which holds the attachments and the plastic around the cord where it attachs to the plug also broke which seems dangerous like the wires are now exposed. Definitely not worth over $200, or even worth $50.

reviews.headline: LOVED it, until it randomly stopped heating
reviews.comments: I loved this dryer so much, I was happy to have paid the money I did because it was amazing!!!! Until i plugged it in one day and it just didnt heat up. There was no overheating, or smell, or event, it just didnt work one day. For $250+ dollars after tax, I expected to have it for a few years. I cant afford to replace an item of this price once a year. I am going to reach out to lange to see if they will replace it cause I dont feel like it was fair at all.

reviews.headline: Did not last
reviews.comments: For such an rxpensive hair dryer, I expected it to at least give me 3 or 4 years of use. It stopped blowibg hot air less than a yeaf after purchase.

reviews.headline: I love it!
reviews.comments: I love how light it is

reviews.headline: Don't buy!
reviews.comments: I first bought in Aril 2024, loved the colour, weight of it, the choice of temperature and speed control. It was a great dryer to use apart from where the buttons are placed, as I kept knocking them when using Then after 4 months the heat went. Ulta Beauty replaced the dryer for me, but I'm afraid to say that after 7 months the same thing happened again. I went back to Ulta Beauty and was told that this happens with this brand at lot. not just there hairdryers. For the cost of hairdryer this is not good enough, 2 hairdryers breaking after less than a year is rubbish! Thank you Ulta for replacing the second hairdryer with a different brand

reviews.headline: ZERO HEAT AFTER FOUR MONTHS
reviews.comments: Initially loved this dryer, it's light and powerful. Used 2x a week for four months, then it stopped heating. Ulta doesn't return it. Waiting on L'Ange warranty response. Using my Dyson + Drybar dryers while I wait for L'ange response.

reviews.headline: Short lifespan high price tag
reviews.comments: Lange hair dryers are great until they break...which I've come to find is about a year after purchase.  Same thing happened with first Lange hair dryer that I bought and customer service told me there was nothing they could do.  For this price tag, I would definitely expect more than 365 days of use.

reviews.headline: Great dryer at first
reviews.comments: I though I would love this dryer because I have loved all the other items I have from them. But alas, it worked well at first but now it keeps overheating. I have cleaned the filters etc but nothing has solved the issue.  For a dryer this expensive I expected more.

reviews.headline: Quality is not there! Don't Recommend!
reviews.comments: I have had 3 of these hairdryers over the last 2.5 years. Lange will stand behind their products and send you a new one under their warranty. However they aren't made to last. The first one the plug seperated from the cord after 6 months. Lange replaced it when I contacted them. The second one quit heating up within about 10 months and Lange replaced again under warranty. The third one died this morning after almost 13 months. It wont heat up and not much air is blowing out if it. I checked the filter and its fine. While I love the weight of this hairdryer and it works great when it works. The price point is way to high for something that absolutely does not last. Will be buying a different brand this time. I've never had these kind of issues with cheaper brands.

reviews.headline: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
reviews.comments: I got this hair dryer and the heating element stopped working a month in to using it. I exchanged it thinking that was just a one off thing. My replacement just stopped heating 5 months in and I can no longer exchange it. Such a waste of money. Yes - it's nice when it works but won't stay that way.

media.headline: Don't let the size fool you.
media.caption: Best investment

media.headline: Best dryer I've ever had
media.caption: Dark smudges from the warning label after about 6 months of use

faceoff_positive.comments:
I balked at the price. I talked myself out of this purchase 249 times. On the 250th pep talk, I finally decided that if it was between the L'ange and the Dyson, I was going for the L'ange. And besides, can you really put a price on feeling good and having great hair days? 

I wish I could go back in time and IMMEDIATELY make this purchase! This dryer is amazing. It's so light weight that it makes blowouts a breeze. My hair isn't frizzy or overly dried. I love that I can adjust the temperature as well as the air speed. The magnetic attachments are fantastic. I feel like a hair model. I'm a stay-at-home mother of a 2-year-old with the best hair in the neighborhood. This is hair that doesn't need to do the laundry, or the dishes because it's so shiny and clean that it inspires everything around it to be the same. ü§£ You can officially tell me nothing because my hair and I are having a moment and that moment can simply not be interrupted. 

My sister, who owns a Dyson, said she liked the feel of the L'ange even more than her dryer and adored how quiet the L'ange is too. And then the results on her hair spoke for themselves. 

If you are on the fence about this little beauty, take the plunge. I'm a believer now! I can't wait to take this blow dryer to my hair dresser and have her try it out. This is a game changer!
faceoff_positive.headline: Holy Grail of Haircare!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I seldom leave reviews. But for the price of this product verses functionality I decided to. 
I ordered this and received Sat. Immediately opened it and admired it. The dryer itself was sleek and very light. Not a "cheap" type of light feeling either. Felt well made. Had the rubberized surface like all their other tools. Came with 3 attachments, 2 concentrators and 1 diffuser. Attached magnetically. Upon fiddling with it they seemed to attach quite nicely. Came with a little cleaning brush. It even has self cleaning as well (after the main cleaning to get rid of even smaller debris). Has 3 air flow setting and 3 temp settings. I was even more excited! I uave 2 long hair German shepherds and on the highest air flow would dry them out in no time lol. Now comes Mother's Day to try it out üòÅand it was a huge disappointment üò¢.  The attachments‚Ä¶diffuser is a diffuser but on LOWEST air flow it was still to powerful and was blowing my hair around but stayed attached. The concentrators would not stay on. The slightest tap/bump with my hand or brush to prepare next section knocked them off very easily. Became more of a hassle. Also the positioning of the buttons on the left side of the dryer verses front like most‚Ä¶was a pain. I'm right handed and the slightest touch to them was constantly changing the temp and air flow. Even if a person is left handed the buttons are at the palm and it was still changing my selections. It took so long to dry my hair because I had to keep putting the attachments back on after them getting slightly tapped and they came off or had to keep readjusting the temp and air flow. Now for my hair‚Ä¶.end result was my hair ends (roughly 3"h were fried looking and not smooth. I had to use a straightener to smooth ends. I have never had to do that with my other dryer. Maybe if the company modified it a bit to have the attachments more secure, like maybe a clip or something, and maybe a slim line cover to go over the air and temp buttons, then maybe I'll try it out again.
faceoff_negative.headline: Light, yet powerful

rollup.name: Le Styliste Luxe Digital Salon Dryer
